alert.note: Alert for Aguila Valley; Central La Paz; Gila Bend; Kofa; Tonopah Desert (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 18 at 6:09PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of east central La Paz, northeastern Yuma and Maricopa Counties through 700 PM MST... At 609 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Wenden to 22 miles west of Tonopah to 10 miles west of Palo Verde Nuclear Generation Station to near Painted Rock Dam to near Buckeye. Movement was south at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Buckeye, Tonopah, Palo Verde, Salome, Wenden, Vicksburg, Palo Verde Nuclear Generation Station, Sundad, Harcuvar, Hassayampa and Arlington. This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 10 between mile markers 44 and 118. US Highway 60 between mile markers 41 and 73. AZ Route 72 between mile markers 44 and 49. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Aguila Valley; Central La Paz; Gila Bend; Kofa; Tonopah Desert
